Chinese Simplified (CN): 并且，还想象了自己是有多么地配不上如此出色的他。
Indonesian (IDN): And I envisioned how unfitting I am for him.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): E avevo immaginato quanto fossi inadatta io per lui.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): E poi, immaginai quanto fossi immeritevole per uno come lui.
Turkish (TR): Ve kendimin onun için ne kadar uygunsuz olduğumu hayal ettim.

Steam (ST): Eva clearly told me. It's been repeating over and over in my dreams...
Umineko Project (UP): Eva had told me that clearly.{n}It had repeated endlessly through my dreams...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Eva clearly told me that. It has repeated endlessly through my dreams...
PC Japanese (JP): それをはっきりと絵羽に告げられた。それが夢の中でも何度も何度も繰り返されるのだ…。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): それをはっきりと絵羽に告げられた。{n}それが夢の中でも何度も何度も繰り返されるのだ…。
Russian (RU): Ева чётко сказала мне об этом.{n}И это слова непрерывно повторялись сквозь мои мечты...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eva havia me dito claramente.{n}Isso havia se repetido infinitamente pelos meus sonhos...
Vietnamese (VI): Eva had told me that clearly.{n}It had repeated endlessly through my dreams...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 繪羽明明白白地告知了我這一點。{n}而那番話，即便是在夢中都反反覆覆地出現了好多次…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 绘羽明明白白地告知了我这一点。{n}而那番话，即便是在梦中都反反复复地出现了好多次…。
Indonesian (IDN): Eva had told me that clearly.{n}It had repeated endlessly through my dreams...
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Eva me l'aveva detto chiaramente. E si era ripetuto senza fine nei miei sogni...
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Eva me lo aveva detto con chiarezza.{n}Mi era stato ripetuto innumerevoli volte anche dentro ai miei sogni...
Turkish (TR): Eva bana bunu açıkça söylemişti.{n}Rüyalarımda hiç durmadan tekrarlanıyordu...

Speaker: Kanon
Steam (ST): "......You're still as clumsy as always, Nee-san. Milady has been in a bad mood since this morning. That just now happened because you talked too much, when you should've just hung your head in silence."
Umineko Project (UP): ".........You're still as clumsy as always, Nee‐san. Madam has been in a bad mood since this morning. You spoke out of turn when you should have hung your head in silence."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ".........You're still as clumsy as always, Nee-san. Milady has been in a bad mood since this morning. That happened because you said too much when you should have hung your head in silence."
PC Japanese (JP): 「………姉さんは相変わらず不器用だね。奥様は今朝から虫の居所が悪い。黙って俯いてればいいものを、余計なことを言うから。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………姉さんは相変わらず不器用だね。奥様は今朝から虫の居所が悪い。黙って頷いてればいいものを、余計なことを言うから」
Russian (RU): ".........Ты всё такая же неуклюжая, нээ‐сан. Миледи с самого утра была в дурном настроении. Это случилось из‐за того, что ты слишком много наговорила, когда тебе следовало опустить голову и промолчать."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Você ainda é atrapalhada como sempre, nee‐san. A madame esteve de mau humor desde de manhã. Você falou na hora errada, quando deveria ter baixado sua cabeça em silêncio."

Steam (ST): I could sense a delicious aroma wafting from the kitchen, even though it was far away, and my empty stomach was encouraged even more.

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 離れているはずの厨房から、美味しい匂いが漂ってくるように感じ、一層、空腹の胃袋を刺激する。

Steam (ST): The name of the woman with elegant blonde hair, drawn as the subject of that portrait, was {f:5:Beatrice}.

Steam (ST): ...It was whispered that she might be the former mistress of Kinzo, the Family Head. ......And also that she was the great witch who had given Kinzo the gold of the legend.

Russian (RU): ...Шептались, что она могла быть бывшей любовницей Кинзо.{n}......И о том, что она была великой ведьмой, давшей Кинзо то знаменитое золото из легенды.

Steam (ST): The witch, {f:5:Beatrice}, master of the night on Rokkenjima. She was gracious to those who respected her, but she would surely curse those who made light of her.

Steam (ST): "Humans have continually searched for the elements that make up the world, since before the modern era. It is said that in ancient times, the Greeks tried explaining the world with the four elements of wind, fire, water, and earth.
Umineko Project (UP): "Humans have been continually searching for the elements that make up the world since before the Christian Era. It is said that the ancient Greeks tried explaining the world with the four elements of air, fire, water, and earth."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Humans have continually searched for the elements that make up the world since before the modern era. It is said that in the ancient times, Greeks tried explaining the world with the four elements of wind, fire, water, and earth.
PC Japanese (JP): 「人間は世界を構成する元素について、紀元前の昔から探求を続けてきた。古代ギリシャ人たちは風火水土の４つで世界の説明を試みたという。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「人間は世界を構成する元素について、紀元前の昔から探求を続けてきた。古代ギリシャ人たちは風火水土の４つで世界の説明を試みたという」
Russian (RU): "Люди беспрестанно искали элементы, из которых состоит этот мир, ещё до прихода нашей эры. Говорят, что в древние времена греки пытались объяснить мир при помощи четырёх элементов: ветра, земли, огня и воды."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Humanos estiveram continuamente procurando pelos elementos que formam o mundo desde antes da Era Cristã. Dizem que os gregos antigos tentaram explicar o mundo com os quatro elementos: ar, fogo, água e terra."
Vietnamese (VI): "Humans have been continually searching for the elements that make up the world since before the Christian Era. It is said that the ancient Greeks tried explaining the world with the four elements of air, fire, water, and earth."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「人類自公元前的遠古時代起，就一直在探求著構成世界的元素。據說古希臘人曾嘗試過用風火水土四元素來解釋世界。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「人类自公元前的远古时代起，就一直在探求着构成世界的元素。据说古希腊人曾尝试过用风火水土四元素来解释世界。」
Indonesian (IDN): "Humans have been continually searching for the elements that make up the world since before the Christian Era. It is said that the ancient Greeks tried explaining the world with the four elements of air, fire, water, and earth."
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Gli umani hanno continuamente cercato gli elementi che creavano il mondo sin da prima dell'era moderna. Si diceva che nei tempi antichi, i Greci provarono a spiegare il mondo con i quattro elementi di vento, fuoco, acqua e terra.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Sin dai tempi più remoti, gli umani hanno costantemente cercato gli elementi che compongono il mondo. Si dice che gli antichi greci provarono a spiegare il mondo usandone quattro: aria, fuoco, acqua e terra."
Turkish (TR): "İnsanlar, Hristiyanlık Dönemi öncesinden beri sürekli olarak dünyayı oluşturan unsurları araştırıyorlar. Eski Yunanlıların dünyayı hava, ateş, su ve topraktan oluşan dört elementle açıklamaya çalıştıkları söylenir."

Steam (ST): And after that, over several millennia, humans added several elements to those four, trying to explain the world with several interpretations such as the five elements, the six elements, the seven elements, the eight elements, and the twelve elements, but they were never able to describe the one sole truth that exists, the "single element"."
Umineko Project (UP): "And after that, over several millennia, humans added several elements to those four, trying to explain the world with a host of interpretations—the five elements, the six elements, the seven elements, the eight elements, the twelve elements—but they could never explain the one true "single element"."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): And after that, over several millennia, humans added several elements to those four, trying to explain the world with several interpretations such as the five elements, the six elements, the seven elements, the eight elements, and the twelve elements, but they couldn't explain the one true 'single element'.
PC Japanese (JP): その後も数千年かけて人間たちは、その４つに様々な元素を加え、五大、六大、七大、八大、十二大と、様々な解釈で世界を説明しようとしたが、唯一の真実である“一なる元素”を説明することはできなかった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「その後も数千年かけて人間たちは、その４つに様々な元素を加え、五大、六大、七大、八大、十二大と、様々な解釈で世界を説明しようとしたが、唯一の真実である“一なる元素”を説明することはできなかった」
Russian (RU): "И потом, в течение нескольких тысячелетий, люди добавили к этим четырём ещё некоторые новые элементы, пытаясь объяснить мир пятью, шестью, семью, восьмью, девятью и двенадцатью элементами, но они не могли объяснить один истинный 'единый элемент'."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "E depois disso, por muitos milênios, humanos adicionaram diversos elementos a esses quatro, tentando explicar o mundo com incontáveis interpretações — os cinco elementos, os seis elementos, os sete elementos, os oito elementos, os doze elementos — mas eles nunca conseguiram explicar o verdadeiro e "único elemento"."
Vietnamese (VI): "And after that, over several millennia, humans added several elements to those four, trying to explain the world with a host of interpretations—the five elements, the six elements, the seven elements, the eight elements, the twelve elements—but they could never explain the one true "single element"."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「之後的數千年，人類們也在這四元素之後添加了各種各樣的元素，以五大、六大、七大、八大、十二大等各種各樣的解釋，試圖去解釋世界，可這些都未能解釋清楚那唯一的真實“第一元素”。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「之后的数千年，人类们也在这四元素之后添加了各种各样的元素，以五大、六大、七大、八大、十二大等各种各样的解释，试图去解释世界，可这些都未能解释清楚那唯一的真实“第一元素”。」
Indonesian (IDN): "And after that, over several millennia, humans added several elements to those four, trying to explain the world with a host of interpretations—the five elements, the six elements, the seven elements, the eight elements, the twelve elements—but they could never explain the one true "single element"."
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): E dopo ciò, nei millenni a venire, gli umani aggiunsero molti altri elementi a quei quattro, provando a spiegare il mondo con molte interpretazioni come quella dei cinque elementi, dei sei, dei sette, degli otto, e dei dodici elementi, ma non riuscirono a spiegare l'unico vero ‘singolo elemento’.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Dopodiché, nei millenni successivi, gli umani aggiunsero a questi quattro molti altri elementi, provando a descrivere il mondo con svariate interpretazioni, come quelle dei cinque, dei sei, dei sette, degli otto, e dei dodici elementi, ma non riuscirono ad esplicare il solo vero ‘unico elemento’..."

Steam (ST): "That man explained everything in the world with love. That is the single element. That man fully explained how the world was constructed with the smallest possible number.
Umineko Project (UP): "That man explained everything in the world with love. That is the single element. With the smallest possible number, that man fully explained how the world was constructed."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "That man explained everything in the world with love. That is the single element. That man fully explained how the world was constructed with the smallest number.
PC Japanese (JP): 「その男は世界の全てを愛で説明した。それこそが一なる元素。男は最小の数で世界の構成を説明しきったのだ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「その男は世界の全てを愛で説明した。それこそが一なる元素。男は最小の数で世界の構成を説明しきったのだ」
Russian (RU): "Этот человек объяснил всё в этом мире при помощи любви. Это и есть единый элемент. Для описания устройства этого мира ему оказалось достаточно лишь единицы."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Aquele homem explicou tudo no mundo com o amor. Esse é o único elemento. Com o menor número possível, aquele homem explicou totalmente como o mundo foi construído."
Vietnamese (VI): "That man explained everything in the world with love. That is the single element. With the smallest possible number, that man fully explained how the world was constructed."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「這名男子以愛解釋了整個世界。而這愛，正是那第一元素。他以最小的數量解釋清楚了世界的構成。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「这名男子以爱解释了整个世界。而这爱，正是那第一元素。他以最小的数量解释清楚了世界的构成。」
Indonesian (IDN): "That man explained everything in the world with love. That is the single element. With the smallest possible number, that man fully explained how the world was constructed."
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Quell'uomo spiegò ogni cosa nel mondo con l'amore. Quello è il singolo elemento. Quell'uomo spiegò totalmente come il mondo fu creato con il più piccolo numero.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Mediante l'amore, quell'uomo spiegò ogni cosa nel mondo. Poiché esso è l'unico elemento. Egli spiegò alla perfezione come, a partire da una minuscola quantità, venne creato il mondo..."
Turkish (TR): "O adam dünyadaki her şeyi aşkla açıkladı. Bu tek element. Mümkün olan en küçük sayı ile o adam dünyanın nasıl inşa edildiğini tam olarak açıkladı."

Steam (ST): ...How simple and clear, how splendid, exhilarating, pleasant and thrilling. ...The year that man was finally born is called the start of the modern era. ...*cackle*cackle*!"

Steam (ST): Shannon lost any words to speak. She thought that when first meeting an unknown guest, her first words should be to ask that person's name.
Umineko Project (UP): Shannon lost any words to speak. She thought that when first meeting an unknown guest, her first words should ask that person's name.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Shannon lost any words to speak. She thought that when first meeting an unknown guest, her first words should ask that person's name.
PC Japanese (JP): 紗音は言葉を失っていた。この初対面の未知なる客人に、名前を聞くのが最初の言葉であるべきだと思った。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 紗音は言葉を失っていた。この初対面の未知なる客人に、名前を聞くのが最初の言葉であるべきだと思った。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Shannon perdeu quaisquer palavras que tinha para falar. Ela pensou que quando se encontra um hóspede desconhecido, suas primeiras palavras deveriam perguntar o nome da pessoa.
Vietnamese (VI): Shannon lost any words to speak. She thought that when first meeting an unknown guest, her first words should ask that person's name.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 纱音无言以对。她本是觉得，对这位初次见面的陌生客人，理当该先问其名才是。
Indonesian (IDN): Shannon lost any words to speak. She thought that when first meeting an unknown guest, her first words should ask that person's name.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Shannon non seppe più cosa dire. Pensò che era al primo incontro con un ospite sconosciuto, le sue prime parole avrebbero dovuto domandare il nome di quella persona.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Shannon rimase senza parole. Pensò che, quando si incontrava per la prima volta un ospite sconosciuto, bisognasse iniziare un discorso chiedendogli il nome.
Turkish (TR): Shannon söyleyecek söz bulamadı. Tanımadığı bir misafirle ilk kez karşılaştığında, ilk sözlerinin o kişinin adını sormak olması gerektiğini düşünüyordu.

Steam (ST): But without saying anything, ...Shannon knew this person's name, so she refrained.
Umineko Project (UP): But without saying anything, ...Shannon knew this person's name, so she refrained.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): But without saying anything, ...Shannon knew this person's name, so she refrained.

Vietnamese (VI): But without saying anything, ...Shannon knew this person's name, so she refrained.

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "The source of your troubles is love. ......Love, the single element that makes up this world. In other words, it is everything in this world. ......When it is lacking, then your world is lacking too. It is no different than scooping water into a canteen with a hole in it.
Umineko Project (UP): "Your worries are due to love. ......Which is the single element of the world. In other words, everything of this world. ......When that is not whole, it means the world is not whole. It is like continually scooping water into a flask with a hole in it."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Your worries are due to love. ......Which is the single element of the world. In other words, everything of this world. ......When that is not fulfilled, it means the world is not fulfilled. It is like continually scooping water into a flask with a hole in it.
PC Japanese (JP): 「お前の悩みは愛ゆえよ。……それは即ち、世界の一なる元素。つまり、この世の全てだ。……それが満たされぬということは、世界が満たされぬに同じこと。それは穴の空いた水筒に水を汲み続けるのに似ている。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「お前の悩みは愛ゆえよ。……それは即ち、世界の一なる元素。つまり、この世の全てだ。……それが満たされぬということは、世界が満たされぬに同じこと。それは穴の空いた水筒に水を汲み続けるのに似ている」
Russian (RU): "Источник всех твоих переживаний — любовь. ......Тот самый единый элемент этого мира. Или, выражаясь иначе, всё в этом мире. ......Когда это чувство не получает воплощения, то и мир является ущербным. Всё равно что пытаться наполнить водой дырявое ведро."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Suas preocupações são devido ao amor. ......O qual é o único elemento do mundo. Em outras palavras, todas as coisas deste mundo. ......Quando isso não está completo, significa que o mundo não está completo. É como continuamente recolher água em um frasco com um buraco nele."
Vietnamese (VI): "Your worries are due to love. ......Which is the single element of the world. In other words, everything of this world. ......When that is not whole, it means the world is not whole. It is like continually scooping water into a flask with a hole in it."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「你的煩惱是因愛而生。……愛，也就是世界的第一元素。換言之，也即是整個世界。……它不完整，即等同於世界不完整。就像是不斷地將水倒進開著個洞的水壺之中一樣。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「你的烦恼是因爱而生。……爱，也就是世界的第一元素。换言之，也即是整个世界。……它不完整，即等同于世界不完整。就像是不断地将水倒进开着个洞的水壶之中一样。」
Indonesian (IDN): "Your worries are due to love. ......Which is the single element of the world. In other words, everything of this world. ......When that is not whole, it means the world is not whole. It is like continually scooping water into a flask with a hole in it."
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Le tue pene sono causate dall'amore. ... Il singolo elemento del mondo. {n}In altre parole, tutto quanto vi è su questo pianeta. ... Quando non viene appagato, significa che il mondo non è completo. È come versare di continuo dell'acqua in una fiasca bucata.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "La causa delle tue pene è l'amore... Vale a dire, l'unico elemento di cui è fatto il mondo. In altre parole, ogni cosa in questo creato... Venirne privati è come privarlo al proprio mondo. È paragonabile al versare acqua continuamente in un'otre bucata..."

Russian (RU): "Ты понимаешь? Тем, что познали Адам и Ева, вкусив плод знаний, была любовь. ...Из‐за этого люди оказались изгнаны из райского сада и стали просто 'людьми'. Это означает, что то, что делает человека человеком — это познание любви и страданий."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Você compreende? O que Adão e Eva aprenderam quando colocaram a fruta do conhecimento em seus lábios foi o amor. ...Por causa disso, os humanos foram expulsos do Paraíso e se tornaram "humanos". O que significa que o que faz de alguém humano é saber amar e sofrer."

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Capisci? Quello che scoprirono Adamo ed Eva quando portarono alle labbra il frutto della conoscenza, era l'amore... E avendo tale conoscenza, l'uomo venne cacciato dall'Eden, divenendo {i:umano}. Ciò significa che uno è umano perché conosce l'amore e soffre..."

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "...I may not differ much from the image of a detestable witch that you hold in your mind. However, I do bestow my favor upon those who respect me. Aren't humans the same? Well, I doubt any human would bestow a favor upon one with such a hostile attitude."
Umineko Project (UP): "......I may be no different from the image of a detestable witch that you humans hold in your minds. However, I respond with goodwill to those who respect me. Aren't humans the same? Although, I doubt any human would respond with goodwill to a hostile attitude like that..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......I may be no different from the image of a detestable witch that you hold in your mind. However, I grant my favor to those who respect me. Aren't humans the same? Well, I doubt any human would grant their favor to a hostile attitude like that."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……妾は確かにそなたらが忌み嫌う魔女像から離れはせぬ。だが、妾は敬う者には好意を返す。それは人間も同じであろう？　そのように身構えられて好意を返せる人間も、またおらぬと思うがな？」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……妾は確かにそなたらが忌み嫌う魔女像から離れはせぬ。だが、妾は敬う者には好意を返す。それは人間も同じであろう？　そのように身構えられて好意を返せる人間も、またおらぬと思うがな？」
Russian (RU): "......Я, конечно, не стану отделять себя от образа той злой ведьмы, которую ты знаешь. Однако я благосклонна к тем, кто уважает меня. Разве с людьми не так же? Хотя я и сомневаюсь, что найдётся человек, который отплатит тебе добром за то, как ты таращишься на него, не находишь?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Posso não ser diferente da imagem de uma bruxa detestável que vocês humanos mantêm em suas mentes. Porém, respondo com boa vontade àqueles que me respeitam. Humanos não são o mesmo? Mas duvido que qualquer humano responderia com boa vontade a uma atitude tão hostil como essa."
Vietnamese (VI): "......I may be no different from the image of a detestable witch that you humans hold in your minds. However, I respond with goodwill to those who respect me. Aren't humans the same? Although, I doubt any human would respond with goodwill to a hostile attitude like that..."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……妾身確實是並未偏離汝等忌諱厭惡的魔女形象。但妾身會對敬吾之人還以好意。人類也是如此吧？不過妾身倒也覺得，也是不會有人類面對著這麼一副小心提防的架勢，還能還得出好意呢。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……妾身确实是并未偏离汝等忌讳厌恶的魔女形象。但妾身会对敬吾之人还以好意。人类也是如此吧？不过妾身倒也觉得，也是不会有人类面对着这么一副小心提防的架势，还能还得出好意呢。」
Indonesian (IDN): "......I may be no different from the image of a detestable witch that you humans hold in your minds. However, I respond with goodwill to those who respect me. Aren't humans the same? Although, I doubt any human would respond with goodwill to a hostile attitude like that..."

Ciononostante, concedo il mio favore a coloro che mi rispettano. {n}Gli umani non fanno forse lo stesso? Beh, dubito che un umano garantisca i suoi favori a un atteggiamento ostile come quello."

Steam (ST): "I say that I can arrange for you to be joined with the man who has captured your heart. Think of it as a sign of my gratitude for your diligence in polishing my portrait day after day."

Chinese Simplified (CN): …纱音马上就联想到了。{n}这指的是，建在那块甚至不能称为小岛的岩礁之上的鸟居与镇守之社。乘船到访六轩岛时会途经那里。

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "Hmm... Yes, yes, you are quite right. It's just as you say. If you don't break the mirror, the same unbreakable days that have passed until now will continue into tomorrow and the next day. Why don't I give you an absolute guarantee?"
Umineko Project (UP): "Hmm... I see, I see, that is quite right. It's just as you say. If you don't break it, the same unbreakable days that have passed until today will continue into tomorrow, and the day after. Why don't I give you an absolute guarantee?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Hmm... I see, I see, that is quite right. It's just as you say. If you don't break that, the same unbreakable days that have passed until today will continue into tomorrow and the next day. Why don't I give you an absolute guarantee?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「ふむ…。なるほどなるほど、それはもっともだな。そなたの言う通りだ。あれを割らぬなら、割れぬ今日までと同じ日々が明日も明後日も続こうぞ。妾が絶対の保証をしようではないか。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「ふむ…。なるほどなるほど、それはもっともだな。そなたの言う通りだ。あれを割らぬなら、割れぬ今日までと同じ日々が明日も明後日も続こうぞ。妾が絶対の保証をしようではないか」
Russian (RU): "Хм... Понятно, понятно, это совершенно верно. Всё в точности так, как ты и говоришь. Если ты не разобьёшь его, те же самые не сулящие перемен дни, протянувшиеся до этого момента, будут продолжаться и завтра, и послезавтра. Почему бы мне не дать тебе абсолютной гарантии?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Hmm... Entendo, entendo, você está absolutamente correta. É assim como você diz. Se não o quebrar, os mesmo dias inquebráveis que se passaram até hoje continuarão amanhã, e no dia seguinte. Por que não lhe dou uma garantia absoluta?"
Vietnamese (VI): "Hmm... I see, I see, that is quite right. It's just as you say. If you don't break it, the same unbreakable days that have passed until today will continue into tomorrow, and the day after. Why don't I give you an absolute guarantee?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「嗯…。原來如此原來如此，這倒是確實啊。就如汝所說。要是不去打碎它，那無異於今日之前的那些不會破碎的日子，哪怕是明天、後天，都會一直持續下去。妾身就對此作出絕對的保證吧。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「嗯…。原来如此原来如此，这倒是确实啊。就如汝所说。要是不去打碎它，那无异于今日之前的那些不会破碎的日子，哪怕是明天、后天，都会一直持续下去。妾身就对此作出绝对的保证吧。」
Indonesian (IDN): "Hmm... I see, I see, that is quite right. It's just as you say. If you don't break it, the same unbreakable days that have passed until today will continue into tomorrow, and the day after. Why don't I give you an absolute guarantee?"
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Hmm... capisco, capisco, non hai tutti i torti. È come dici tu. Se non lo rompi, gli stessi giorni infrangibili che si sono susseguiti fino ad oggi continueranno nel domani e il giorno dopo ancora. Perché non darti una garanzia assoluta?"
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Mmh... Capisco, capisco, mi sembra giusto. È proprio come dici tu.{n}Se non romperai lo specchio, i giorni trascorsi sempre nella stessa maniera proseguiranno intatti, anche domani e dopodomani. Perché non darti una garanzia assoluta?"
Turkish (TR): "Hmm... Anlıyorum, anlıyorum, bu oldukça doğru. Aynı dediğin gibi. Eğer onu kırmazsan, bugüne kadar geçen aynı sorunsuz günler yarına ve ertesi güne de devam edecek. Neden sana kesin bir garanti vermiyorum?"

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "I will do nothing but grant you a chance to bring your feelings to fruition. ...It's up to you to decide whether you'll break it or not. If you break it, I shall grant your wish."
Umineko Project (UP): "I have done nothing more than give you the opportunity to have your feelings fulfilled as a reward. ......It's up to you whether you break it or not. If you break it, I will grant your wish."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "What I will do is nothing more than give you a chance to fulfill your feelings as a reward. ......It's up to you whether you try to break it or not. If you break it, I will grant your wish."
PC Japanese (JP): 「妾はあくまでも褒美としてそなたに想いを成就する機会を与えたに過ぎぬ。……割ろうが割るまいが、そなたの自由だ。割れば、妾はそなたの願いを叶える。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「妾はあくまでも褒美としてそなたに想いを成就する機会を与えたに過ぎぬ。……割ろうが割るまいが、そなたの自由だ。割れば、妾はそなたの願いを叶える」
Russian (RU): "То, что сделаю я — не более чем возможность для тебя воплотить свои чувства в качестве награды. ......Разбивать его или нет — решать тебе. Если ты разобьёшь его, я исполню твоё желание."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Eu não fiz nada mais que lhe dar a oportunidade de ter seus sentimentos realizados como uma recompensa. ......Cabe a você decidir se o quebra ou não.{n}Se o quebrar, concederei seu desejo."
Vietnamese (VI): "I have done nothing more than give you the opportunity to have your feelings fulfilled as a reward. ......It's up to you whether you break it or not. If you break it, I will grant your wish."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「妾身說到底，只不過是想作為獎賞，給予汝一個成就汝之思戀的機會。……去打碎還是不去打碎，是汝的自由。打碎了，妾身就會實現汝的願望。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「妾身说到底，只不过是想作为奖赏，给予汝一个成就汝之思恋的机会。……去打碎还是不去打碎，是汝的自由。打碎了，妾身就会实现汝的愿望。」
Indonesian (IDN): "I have done nothing more than give you the opportunity to have your feelings fulfilled as a reward. ......It's up to you whether you break it or not. If you break it, I will grant your wish."
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Ciò che intendo fare non è altro che darti come ricompensa una possibilità di realizzare i tuoi sentimenti. ... Sta a te provare a romperlo o meno. Se lo farai, esaudirò il tuo desiderio."
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Voglio solamente concederti come ricompensa la possibilità di realizzare le tue speranze... Sta a te romperlo o non romperlo. Se lo romperai, esaudirò il tuo desiderio."
Turkish (TR): "Sana ödül olarak duygularını tatmin etme fırsatı vermekten başka bir şey yapmadım. ......Kırıp kırmamak sana kalmış. Eğer kırarsan, dileğini yerine getireceğim."

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "If you don't, the tomorrows that came before today will continue for all eternity. Your wish will not be granted for all time. ...Do you understand? Do you see what I mean? *cackle*cackle*."
Umineko Project (UP): "If you do not break it, the tomorrows up until today will continue for all time. Your wish will not be granted for all eternity. ......Do you understand? What I am saying? *cackle*cackle*."

Russian (RU): "Если ты не разобьёшь его, то такие дни, как сегодня, будут длиться вечно. Твоё желание так никогда и не исполнится. ......Ты ведь понимаешь? О чём я тебе толкую? Ха‐ха."

Steam (ST): She was pressing Shannon, saying she must break the mirror if she ever wanted to be united with George. It was a declaration...that Shannon's feelings would never be brought to fruition unless she broke it...
Umineko Project (UP): She was pressing her, saying to break the mirror, if she wanted to be joined with George.{n}And she was declaring that if she didn't break it, then her feelings would definitely never be fulfilled......
Original Witch Hunt (OG): She was pressing Shannon, saying that if she wanted to be joined with George, break the mirror. And she was announcing that if Shannon didn't break it, then her feelings would definitely never be fulfilled......
PC Japanese (JP): 譲治と結ばれたかったら、鏡を割れと、迫っているのだ。そして割らないなら、絶対にその想いは叶わないと宣告している……。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela estava pressionando‐a, dizendo‐lhe para quebrar o espelho, se ela quisesse ser unida com George.{n}E ela estava declarando que se ela não o quebrasse, seus sentimentos definitivamente nunca seriam realizados......

Chinese Simplified (CN): 逼迫般地说着，若想与让治结合，就去打碎镜子。{n}宣判般地说着，若不去打碎，这份思恋就绝对不会如愿以偿……。
Indonesian (IDN): She was pressing her, saying to break the mirror, if she wanted to be joined with George.{n}And she was declaring that if she didn't break it, then her feelings would definitely never be fulfilled......
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Stava incalzando Shannon, dicendo che, se voleva stare assieme a George, avrebbe dovuto infrangere lo specchio. E stava annunciando che se non l'avesse fatto, i suoi sentimenti non sarebbero mai stati appagati...
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Le stava mettendo pressione, dicendole che se voleva essere legata a George, doveva rompere lo specchio.{n}E che se non lo avrebbe rotto, le speranze di Shannon non sarebbero mai state portate a compimento...

Steam (ST): Kanon didn't care who this woman was. If this was an enemy tormenting Shannon, whom he loved and respected as a sister, nothing else mattered.
Umineko Project (UP): Kanon didn't care who this woman was.{n}As long as he knew she was an enemy tormenting Shannon, who he loved and respected as a sister, nothing else mattered.

PC Japanese (JP): 嘉音にとって、この女が誰かはどうでもいい。姉と慕い敬愛する紗音を苛めている敵であることがわかるなら、それ以上のことはどうでもよかった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 嘉音にとって、この女が誰かはどうでもいい。{n}姉と慕い敬愛する紗音を苛めている敵であることがわかるなら、それ以上のことはどうでもよかった。
Russian (RU): Канону было всё равно, кем была эта женщина.{n}Пока он был уверен, что она враг, мучащий Шаннон, которую он любил и уважал как родную сестру, остальное не имело никакого значения.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Kanon não ligava para quem era aquela mulher.{n}Contanto que ele soubesse que ela era uma inimiga atormentando Shannon, quem ele amava e respeitava como uma irmã, nada mais importava.

Indonesian (IDN): Kanon didn't care who this woman was.{n}As long as he knew she was an enemy tormenting Shannon, who he loved and respected as a sister, nothing else mattered.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Non gli interessava sapere chi fosse quella donna. Finché sapeva che era un nemico che stava tormentando Shannon, che amava e rispettava come sorella, non importava nient'altro.

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "......Very well. If you ask, I will forgive you just this once. ...Kanon, is it? In deference to her, I shall forgive you tonight and send you off. You ought to thank me. Well then, let us call it a night."
Umineko Project (UP): ".........Very well. At your request, I will grant him special pardon. ...Kanon, is it? In deference to her, I shall forgive you tonight and send you off. Be thankful. Well then, we will disperse for tonight."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ".........Very well. If you ask, I will permit it this time. ...Kanon is it? In deference to her, I shall forgive you tonight and send you off. You should thank me. Well then, we will disperse for tonight."
PC Japanese (JP): 「………良かろう。そなたが求めるなら特別に許そう。…嘉音とやら。彼女に免じて今宵は許してつかわす。感謝するがよいぞ。さて、今宵はこれで退散する。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………良かろう。そなたが求めるなら特別に許そう。…嘉音とやら。彼女に免じて今宵は許してつかわす。感謝するがよいぞ。さて、今宵はこれで退散する」
Russian (RU): ".........Ну ладно. Если ты так просишь, то на сей раз я сделаю вид, что ничего не слышала. ...Как там тебя, Канон? Из уважения к ней, сегодня я прощаю тебя и покину вас. Ты должен быть благодарен мне. Ну что ж, на этом мы и разойдёмся."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Muito bem. A seu pedido, concederei a ele um perdão especial. ...Kanon, é? Em deferência a ela, devo lhe perdoar esta noite e liberá‐lo. Fique agradecido. Pois bem, nos dispersaremos por esta noite."
Vietnamese (VI): ".........Very well. At your request, I will grant him special pardon. ...Kanon, is it? In deference to her, I shall forgive you tonight and send you off. Be thankful. Well then, we will disperse for tonight."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………也罷。若這是汝之所求的話，那妾身就特予原諒好了。…叫嘉音的。看在她的份上，今宵就饒恕汝一次。感謝妾身吧。成了，妾身今宵就此告辭了。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………也罢。若这是汝之所求的话，那妾身就特予原谅好了。…叫嘉音的。看在她的份上，今宵就饶恕汝一次。感谢妾身吧。成了，妾身今宵就此告辞了。」
Indonesian (IDN): ".........Very well. At your request, I will grant him special pardon. ...Kanon, is it? In deference to her, I shall forgive you tonight and send you off. Be thankful. Well then, we will disperse for tonight."

Steam (ST): When {f:5:Beatrice} grinned broadly and snapped her fingers, their left hands stretched out in front of them against their will...and their palms opened.

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "A simple greeting. I have no hidden motive. ...It is nothing more than a bruise, so it will heal in just a few days. There's not even any need to care for it. I made that mark so that tomorrow, you will not forget that I truly was here, and that I made a promise with you."
Umineko Project (UP): "It is a simple greeting. I have no hidden motive. ...It is nothing more than a bruise, so it will heal in just a few days. It requires no treatment. That is a mark so that tomorrow, you will not forget that I truly was here, and that I made a promise with you."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "It is a simple greeting. I have no hidden motive. ...It is nothing more than a bruise, so it will heal in just a few days. There's not even any need to care for it. That is a mark so that tomorrow, you will not forget that I truly was here, and that I made a promise with you."
PC Japanese (JP): 「単なる挨拶よ。他意はない。…ただの痣に過ぎぬから、ほんの数日で癒えよう。手当ても必要ない。それは、妾が確かに今日ここにあり、そなたと約束を交わしたことを明日に忘れさせぬための印だ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「単なる挨拶よ。他意はない。…ただの痣に過ぎぬから、ほんの数日で癒えよう。手当ても必要ない。それは、妾が確かに今日ここにあり、そなたと約束を交わしたことを明日に忘れさせぬための印だ」
Russian (RU): "Обыкновенное приветствие. У меня нет никакого тайного умысла. ...Это не более чем синяк, поэтому он заживёт спустя несколько дней. Вы можете даже не беспокоиться о нём. Этот знак предназначен для того, чтобы завтра вы не забыли, что я действительно была здесь и дала вам своё обещание."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "É uma simples saudação. Não tenho um motivo oculto. ...Não é nada mais que uma ferida, então irá sarar em apenas alguns dias. Não requer tratamento. Essa é uma marca para que, amanhã, vocês não se esqueçam que eu verdadeiramente estive aqui e que fiz uma promessa a vocês."
Vietnamese (VI): "It is a simple greeting. I have no hidden motive. ...It is nothing more than a bruise, so it will heal in just a few days. It requires no treatment. That is a mark so that tomorrow, you will not forget that I truly was here, and that I made a promise with you."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「只是餞別。別無他意。…這只不過是普通的痣，過了數日便會治癒。無需醫治。這是個印記。以示妾身今日確實在此與汝定下過約定，不讓汝明日忘記。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「只是饯别。别无他意。…这只不过是普通的痣，过了数日便会治愈。无需医治。这是个印记。以示妾身今日确实在此与汝定下过约定，不让汝明日忘记。」
Indonesian (IDN): "It is a simple greeting. I have no hidden motive. ...It is nothing more than a bruise, so it will heal in just a few days. It requires no treatment. That is a mark so that tomorrow, you will not forget that I truly was here, and that I made a promise with you."
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "È un semplice benvenuto. Non ho motivazioni nascoste. ... Non è altro che una scottatura, che passerà in pochi giorni. Non c'è neanche bisogno che ve ne preoccupiate. È un segno così che domani non dimentichiate che sono veramente stata qui, e che ho stretto una promessa con voi."
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "È un semplice saluto. Nessun motivo nascosto... Non è che un livido qualunque, che guarirà in pochi giorni. Non c'è nemmeno bisogno di trattarlo. È un segno lasciato affinché domani non dimentichiate che sono davvero stata qui, e che ho stretto una promessa con te..."

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "......An encounter with me can be quite shocking. ...Sometimes, when the next morning comes, people try to think of such an encounter as a dream or an illusion. ......You ought to consider this slowly and carefully, Shannon. ...And you should probably take a good rest, look at my mark tomorrow morning, and try considering it again."
Umineko Project (UP): "............The impact of a meeting with me is strong. ...Sometimes, at the next morning, people try to think of their meeting with me as a dream or an illusion. ............You should think slowly and carefully, Shannon. ...And you should probably take a good rest, look at my mark tomorrow morning, and try thinking again."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "............The impact of a meeting with me is strong. ...Sometimes, at the next morning, people try to think of their meeting with me as a dream or an illusion. ............You should think slowly and carefully, Shannon. ...And you should probably take a good rest, look at my mark tomorrow morning, and try thinking again."

Russian (RU): "............Впечатления после встречи со мной очень сильны. ...Иногда, на следующее утро, люди думают о встрече со мной как о сне или иллюзии. ............Тебе нужно тщательно и осторожно всё обдумать, Шаннон. ...И, наверное, тебе стоит хорошенько отдохнуть, а завтра, взглянув на мой знак, ещё раз всё обдумать."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "............O impacto de um encontro comigo é forte. ...Às vezes, na manhã seguinte, as pessoas tentam pensar em seu encontro comigo como um sonho ou uma ilusão. ............Você deveria pensar lenta e cuidadosamente, Shannon. ...E você provavelmente deveria ter um bom descanso, olhar para minha marca amanhã de manhã, e tentar pensar novamente."

Steam (ST): They scattered in all directions inside the reception hall, ...leaving a golden splash before disappearing into thin air.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): They scattered in all directions inside the reception hall, ...leaving a golden splash before disappearing into thin air.

Steam (ST): It was so silent, it made both of them think they might've been daydreaming until just a moment ago...
Umineko Project (UP): The extreme silence was enough to make both of them think that they might have been daydreaming until just a moment ago...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The extreme silence was enough to make both of them think that they might have been daydreaming until just a moment ago...
PC Japanese (JP): そのあまりの静けさは、直前まで、嘉音と二人共々、白昼夢でも見ていたのではないかと思わせてしまうほどだった…。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): そのあまりの静けさは、直前まで、嘉音と二人共々、白昼夢でも見ていたのではないかと思わせてしまうほどだった…。
Russian (RU): Этой глубокой тишины было достаточно, чтобы они оба подумали, что всё случившееся несколько минут назад было всего лишь сном...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O silêncio extremo era suficiente para fazer ambos pensarem que deviam estar tendo um devaneio até um momento atrás...
Vietnamese (VI): The extreme silence was enough to make both of them think that they might have been daydreaming until just a moment ago...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這種過分的安靜，甚至使嘉音與紗音兩人不禁詫異，是否直到剛才為止都是一場白日夢…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这种过分的安静，甚至使嘉音与纱音两人不禁诧异，是否直到刚才为止都是一场白日梦…。
Indonesian (IDN): The extreme silence was enough to make both of them think that they might have been daydreaming until just a moment ago...
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Era abbastanza intenso da far pensar loro che avessero sognato ad occhi aperti fino ad un momento fa...
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Quel silenzio era molto imponente, al punto che entrambi arrivarono a pensare di aver sognato ad occhi aperti fino a poco prima...
Turkish (TR): Bu aşırı sessizlik, her ikisinin de bir an öncesine kadar hayal kuruyor olabileceklerini düşünmelerine yetti...

Steam (ST): ...Which was why the witch had left those marks. She had done so to make it impossible for them to think of this as a daydream.
Umineko Project (UP): ...Which is why the witch had left it.{n}She had left a mark to make it impossible for them to think that this was a daydream.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...Which is why the witch had left it. She had left a mark to make it impossible for them to think that this was a daydream.
PC Japanese (JP): …だから魔女は残した。これが白昼夢であると、断じて思わせないために印を残した。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): …だから魔女は残した。{n}これが白昼夢であると、断じて思わせないために印を残した。
Russian (RU): ...Вот потому‐то ведьма и оставила его.{n}Она оставила свой знак, чтобы они не смогли посчитать случившееся сном.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Isso por causa do que a bruxa havia deixado.{n}Ela havia deixado uma marca para impossibilitar ambos pensarem que aquilo era uma alucinação.
Vietnamese (VI): ...Which is why the witch had left it.{n}She had left a mark to make it impossible for them to think that this was a daydream.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …正因如此，魔女才留下了它。{n}為絕對不讓他們將此當成白日夢，而留下了印記。

Indonesian (IDN): ...Which is why the witch had left it.{n}She had left a mark to make it impossible for them to think that this was a daydream.

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Ecco perché la strega aveva lasciato loro quei segni.{n}L'aveva fatto affinché non potessero mai pensare che fosse un sogno avuto mentre erano lucidi.
Turkish (TR): ...İşte bu yüzden cadı onu bırakmıştı.{n}Bunun bir hayal olduğunu düşünmelerini imkansız kılacak bir iz bırakmıştı.

Steam (ST): As Shannon and Kanon remembered the butterfly bruises on their hands and the pain they'd felt when they'd been made, they kept standing still, stunned......
Umineko Project (UP): As Shannon and Kanon thought back on the butterfly bruises on their hands, and the pain they had felt when those had been left, they stood there for some time, stunned and motionless...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): As Shannon and Kanon thought back on the butterfly bruises on their hands, and the pain they had felt when those had been left there, they kept standing still, in shock............
PC Japanese (JP): 紗音と嘉音は、自分の手に残された蝶の痣と、それを記された時に感じた痛みを思い返しながら、いつまでも呆然と立ち尽くしていた…………。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 紗音と嘉音は、自分の手に残された蝶の痣と、それを記された時に感じた痛みを思い返しながら、いつまでも呆然と立ち尽くしていた…。
Russian (RU): Как только Шаннон и Канон вспомнили о синяках в форме бабочек на запястьях, а также боль, которую они ощутили, когда получили их, они так и застыли в шоке...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Enquanto Shannon e Kanon pensaram de volta nas feridas de borboleta em suas mãos, e a dor que haviam sentido quando essas foram deixadas, eles ficaram ali por algum tempo, atordoados e imóveis...
Vietnamese (VI): As Shannon and Kanon thought back on the butterfly bruises on their hands, and the pain they had felt when those had been left, they stood there for some time, stunned and motionless...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 紗音與嘉音回想著手上的蝶痣，與烙下之時感到的痛楚，目瞪口呆地佇立了好久…………。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 纱音与嘉音回想着手上的蝶痣，与烙下之时感到的痛楚，目瞪口呆地伫立了好久…………。
Indonesian (IDN): As Shannon and Kanon thought back on the butterfly bruises on their hands, and the pain they had felt when those had been left, they stood there for some time, stunned and motionless...
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ripensando ai lividi a forma di farfalla presenti sulle loro mani, e il dolore che avevano provato mentre venivano impressi, rimasero immobili, sconvolti...
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Mentre Shannon e Kanon rimembravano i lividi a forma di farfalla sulle loro mani, e il dolore che avevano provato nel riceverli, rimasero per molto tempo immobili e sconvolti...
Turkish (TR): Shannon ve Kanon ellerindeki kelebek morluklarını ve bunlar bırakıldığında hissettikleri acıyı düşünürken, bir süre şaşkın ve hareketsiz bir şekilde öylece durdular...
